title: How to Circle a Number on Microsoft Word

steps.title: Open Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Word. If you’re using Windows, click the Windows menu, select Microsoft Office , then Microsoft Word . If you’re using a Mac, you should find the Microsoft Word icon on the dock or launchpad.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . It’s at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Click Symbol.
steps.content: Click Symbol . You’ll see it on the panel at the top of the screen, toward the right.

steps.title: Click the “Font” drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the “Font” drop-down menu. It’s near the top of the window.

steps.title: Click the “Subset” drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the “Subset” drop-down menu. It’s right next to the “Font” menu.

steps.title: Click the circled number you want to add.
steps.content: Click the circled number you want to add.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . The circled number now appears in your Word document.
